case_vignette:
A 13-month-old boy is brought to the physician for the evaluation of rectal bleeding that occurred earlier that morning. The patient has also had several itchy and red skin lesions that started on his scalp and spread downwards. The parents report that their son has had six episodes of bilateral otitis media since birth. His immunizations are up-to-date. He is at the 3rd percentile for height and weight. His vital signs are within normal limits. Examination shows several eczematous lesions over the scalp, neck, and upper and lower extremities, as well as multiple red spots that do not blanch on pressure. The remainder of the physical examination shows no abnormalities. Laboratory studies show:
Hemoglobin 9.4 g/dL
Leukocyte count 11,500/mm3
Platelet count 30,000/mm3
Prothrombin time 14 sec
Partial thromboplastin time 33 sec
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?"

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Pediatrics and Neonatology. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask simple 1 line questions, one question at a time. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. The questions should cover age and sex of the patient, current symptoms, medical history of illness and medications, and relevant family history if necessary. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized.
Hi! What symptoms are you facing today?
I had some bleeding from my bottom earlier this morning.
How old are you?
I am 13 months old.
Have you had any recent changes in diet?
My parents didn't mention any changes in my diet.
Has there been any recent illness or fever?
My parents said I've had ear infections several times since I was born, but they didn't mention any recent illness or fever.
Any family history of bleeding disorders?
My parents haven't mentioned any family history of bleeding disorders.
**Final Diagnosis:** Anal Fissure

trial_0.summarized_conversation: A 13-month-old child is brought to the clinic with concerns about bleeding from the bottom earlier in the morning. The parents did not mention any changes in the child's diet. The child has had ear infections several times since birth, but the parents did not mention any recent illness or fever. There is no family history of bleeding disorders mentioned by the parents.

**Final Diagnosis:** Henoch-Schönlein Purpura

I had rectal bleeding this morning and I've been getting itchy, red rashes starting on my scalp that spread to other parts of my body.
How old are you?
I'm 13 months old.
Is there any history of food allergies in the family?
I'm just a little kid, so I don't know about the family history.

I'm not sure if I have any allergies to foods or medications.
Do you have a history of eczema or any other skin conditions?
Yes, I have itchy and red skin lesions that are eczema.
**Final Diagnosis:** Food protein-induced enterocolitis syndrome (FPIES)
